page.title: 10Education in Steeple Claydon
page.content: Compulsory education in Buckinghamshire begins the term after a child reaches his 5th birthday.Prior to that Toddlers Group,Playschool and Rising Fives Group (all{voluntary groups charging fees) provide early education from the age of 3. From 5 to 12 the child is taught at the{Allan Shaw Combined}School.This is housed in a modern,open-plan building with a swimming pool and large playing fields.In 1986 further new facilities will be opened and the old building will finally become redundant. In their final year in the Combined School children take three{45 minutes {tests,}which coupled with the school's recommendations,decide whether they go to{Grammar School}(Royal Latin,Buckingham) or{Secondary Modern (Buckingham Secondary) where they remain until 16.
